body.p: IFRS 16 does not require or permit a lessee to measure lease liabilities at fair value after initial measurement. In the IASB’s view, this approach would have been:

li.p: inconsistent with the subsequent measurement of many other non-derivative financial liabilities, thus decreasing comparability for users of financial statements; and
more complex and costly for entities to apply than a cost-based approach, because it requires the use of both current expected cash flows and current interest rates.
